availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
The State of Rhode Island and Providence Plantations.
Providence County ss.

I Henry Martin, residing in Providence, in the County of Providence, in the State of Rhode Island, appointed by the Governor of the State of Kentucky, a Commissioner for said State of Rhode Island, to take the proof and acknowledgment of deeds and other instruments, and to administer oaths pursuant to the act of the legislature of said State of Kentucky, approved January 7. 1852; do solemnly swear, that I will well and faithfully execute and perform all the duties of such Commissioner under and by virtue of the laws of Kentucky.
Taken, subscribed and sworn to this eighteenth day of January in the year A.D. 1862.

Before me
Albert M. Hewitt.
Justice of the Peace.

Providence Rhode Island
November 6th. 1862
Jas W. Tate Esq.
Sir Your Note of 2d Ulto. was received during my absence.

My Commission was duly received. On referring to my Commission, I find that I took and subscribed my Oath of Office. as Commissioner on the Eighteenth Day of January 1862. and on that Day deposited it in our Post Office. directed to you at Frankfort Kentucky.
Nothing appearing in the act appointing Commissioners, relative to a fee to the Secretary of $5. it was not forwarded.
Naming the Fee in your Note. I now enclose $5. U.S. No 84.192.

Rhode Island
Oath of Henry Martin
Comr. of Deeds
Filed Nov 11. 1862
